posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
You can make decent nuke mages with Sorc26/PM10/BG4, Sorc27/PM10/BG3, or Sorc28/PM10/BG2. They won't be able to achieve max DCs but they can also be built as mediocre DC mages. However, these builds only become decent near level 40 and since SP modules are mainly about the journey to 40 this will be a tough character to level. You can either delay your casting potential and aim for PM10 as soon as possible or you can delay the PM immunities in order to improve your caster level. Either way your build won't develop fully until the 30s, which might be acceptable on a PW but will probably be a pain in a SP module.
On top of that half orc is literally the worst race for your build idea. Human is the best race by far, but even dwarf is better than half orc for this build. So not only are you playing a late developing build, you're also purposefully handicapping yourself while doing so.

If you want AC then you should go for either Sorc26/PM10/BG4 or Sorc27/PM10/BG3 and get Auto Still Spell 3 and Divine Shield. There is no point getting Divine Shield if you don't also get AS3 since even with the PM bonus your AC will still be low without armor. If you go for AC then ignore DCs and become a nuke mage. Your DCs will be 5 or 6 points lower than a proper DC mage, and at that point it's usually best to ignore DC spells entirely.
If you drop AC then you should go for either Sorc27/PM10/BG3 or Sorc28/PM10/BG2. This frees up more feats but even if you focus on CHA your DCs will still be 3 or 4 points lower than a proper DC mage. In some environments this isn't a big deal, in others this will make building as a DC mage pointless.

Comparing a human Sorc28/PM10/BG2 and a half orc Sorc28/PM10/BG2, the human has 80 HP and 86 skill points more than the half orc. The half orc can't even invest in discipline due to the low amount of skill points, only Concentration, Spellcraft, and Tumble. Both builds have 32 CHA and ESF: Necro, which is what I suggest aiming for with this build if you want to build as a DC mage.

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
I have played on a couple of balanced PWs where non human races get Racial bonus feats. They are still, typically, not up to par with Human, but they make them more competitive and allow some builds to favour them.

Elf/Halfling/Dwarf have their niches (although Dwarf should net Dwarven Axe). HOrc with Racial Ambidexterity allows those Strength based dual weapons to have some use and HOrc some niche build opportunities. HElf with racial Dodge allows a few more HElf niche builds.

It is interesting how powerful that extra pre-epic feat and +1 skill point per level turns out to be in the end really. Generally far more powerful than the nonhuman stat bonuses.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Well the pre-epic feat = toughness = 40hp (nearly 2 cons without the +1 fort and +1 conc)
+1 skill pt / lvl = nearly 2 int (just without the skill modifiers and spell casting for wizards)

So human could be arguably considered as having nearly +2 int and +2 cons from the beginning, except in builds which have heaps of pre-epic feats (ie heavy fighter builds) and heaps of skill points without good places to spend them (ie pure wizards)
